description: Numbers whose ternary expansion contains no 0.
comments: Complement of A081605. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2003a(n) = A107680(n) + A107681(n); - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 20 2005A081604(A107681(n)) <= A081604(A107680(n)) = A081604(a(n)) = A000523(n+1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 20 2005A077267(a(n)) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 02 2008Subsequence of A154314. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 07 2009A212193(a(n)) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 04 2012
links: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
David Garth and Adam Gouge, Affinely Self-Generating Sets and Morphisms, Journal of Integer Sequences, 10 (2007), Article 07.1.5., 1-13.
C. Kimberling, Affinely recursive sets and orderings of languages, Discrete Math., 274 (2004), 147-160. [From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 31 2012]
formula: a(1)=1, a(n+1) = f(a(n)+1,f(a(n)+1) where f(x,y) = if x<3 and x<>0 then y else if x mod 3 = 0 then f(y+1,y+1) else f(floor(x/3),y). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 02 2008a(2n) = a(2n-1)+1, n>0. - _Zak Seidov_, Jul 27 2009a(2n+1) = 3*a(n)+1. - _Robert Israel_, Aug 05 2015G.f.: x/(1-x)^2 + Sum(m >= 1, 3^(m-1)*x^(2^(m+1)-1)/((1-x^(2^m))*(1-x))). - _Robert Israel_, Aug 04 2015
maple: f:= proc(n) local L,i,m;   L:= convert(n,base,2);   m:= nops(L);   add((1+L[i])*3^(i-1),i=1..m-1);end proc:map(f, [$2..101]); # _Robert Israel_, Aug 04 2015
mathematica: Select[Range@ 240, Last@ DigitCount[#, 3] == 0 &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 05 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)a032924 n = a032924_list !! (n-1)a032924_list = iterate f 1 where   f x = 1 + if r < 2 then x else 3 * f x'  where (x', r) = divMod x 3-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 07 2015, May 04 2012
crossrefs: Zeroless numbers in some other bases <= 10: A000042 (base 2), A023705 (base 4), A248910 (base 6), A255805 (base 8), A255808 (base 9), A052382 (base 10).
author: _Clark Kimberling_
